ygData.subject: Re: PoA bard quests plus a rant
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh that was 2 months ago roughly I guess when  he stated that the majority had a 30-40 level char. By now it s easily up to 35-45 probably higher. So no your
ygData.messageBody:
Heh that was 2 months ago roughly I guess when he stated that the majority
had a 30-40 level char. By now it's easily up to 35-45 probably higher. So
no your wrong and again their aren't problems at mid level you just want
something to be added for it for the hell of it we don't we want it to be
less crowded and able to hunt in zones.

Naeeldar

-----Original Message-----
From: RaceFace <bean@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, January 24, 2000 9:00 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] PoA bard quests plus a rant


>From: "RaceFace" <bean@...>
>
>
>----- Original Message -----
>From: <jhenders@...>
>To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Sent: January 24, 2000 19:44
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] PoA bard quests plus a rant
>
>
>> From: jhenders@...
>>
>> Brad has already stated publicly that the majority of their customers
>> have mid level characters. He stated this when Paw was upgraded so you
>> can take his "mid level" as someone suitable to play Paw. As Brad has
>> direct access to the customer database, I think this provides a perfect
>> example of the uselessness of web polls. The only thing that poll tells
>> you is that 6% of the people who go to everlore and bothered to take the
>> poll (and only voted once) have a 45+ character. I hope you can
>> understand the difference.
>
>Of course I can, that's why I said "if that poll is accurate." I hope you
>can understand. :)
>
>Even going by Brad's statement, if the majority of people have "mid-level"
>characters, they should get the majority of the attention, so the rest of
my
>statement still applies.
>
>
>
